languageKey.label: A digital asset you would like to make available along with a sermon.

A sermon resource is typically a digital asset, either uploaded directly into the resource record or accessed from another website via a web address (URL). A resource may also be another plug-in that you associate with a sermon record.
The language of this resource.
This should be the default language unless this resource represents a translation of another language.
Title of the resource
The title you wish you name this resource with.
Title of the resource
The title you wish you name this resource with.
The type of resource.

Resource type determines what fields are available for a resource. Available fields are description, icon, file, MIME type, and URL. See resource type definition for details on these fields. Resource types can be defined by "Resource Type" records.
tx_wecsermons_resource_types
The general description given for this resource..
The description can be used to briefly describe the resource.
A digitial image associated with a resource.
A graphic can help describe a resource, or be used in a "graphical link" to the resource itself.
A file associated with a resource.

A file is typically the ditial asset you wish to provide to the user of the website. This can be anything such as a PDF file, MS Word Document, digital pictures, etc. The only files that can not be made available are .PHP files.
A valid Mime Type.

MIME type is used in the SMS when generating a Podcast. Podcasts are syndicated feeds that can provide access to files. The MIME type is required in the "enclosure" tag of an RSS feed or Podcast, which makes syndicated information and files available.
RSS Specification|http://blogs.law.harvard.edu/tech/rss,Valid MIME Types|http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/
A web address polnting to an online resource.
The URL can be used to link to a resource that is available on another website, such as streaming audio or streaming video.
